| History                 = An interdimensional holding company/law firm, LL&L had considerable history with the man called [[James Howlett (Earth-616)|Logan]].{{r|Wolverine Vol 2 #5}} They often maintained his assets and property for him when his hectic lifestyle prevented him from maintaining a permanent residence or storage of his own.{{r|Wolverine Vol 2 #79|80}}{{r|Wolverine Vol 2 #93}} It is also an intergalactic holding company.{{r|Deadpool Vol 3 23|25}}

One of their projects dealt with a messiah named Mithras who was prophesied to bring about an intergalactic golden age. [[Zoe Culloden (Earth-616)|Zoe Culloden]] believed [[Wade Wilson (Earth-616)|Deadpool]] to be Mithras.{{r|Deadpool Vol 3 #1}} Later [[Overboss Dixon (Earth-616)|Overboss Dixon]] tried to arrange events so that [[Steven Rogers (Earth-616)|Captain America]] would become the messiah LL&L's precognitives foresaw.{{r|Deadpool Vol 3 23|25}}
| Equipment               =

| Notes                   = * Named after the owners of the Forbidden Planet store.<ref>http://goodcomics.comicbookresources.com/2008/03/27/comic-book-urban-legends-revealed-148/</ref>
| Trivia                  = Similar to the antagonists of Buffy spin-off Angel, Wolfram & Hart: Both are interdimensional law firms manipulating a mass-murderer on the cusp of redemption for his role in the upcoming apocalypse, which debuted a decade later in October of 1999.
